charges.charge_description: BUILDINGS, PROPERTY, WITHIN SPECIAL MARITIME JURISDICTION - willfully and maliciously did destroy and injure a door; In violation of Title 18, United States Code, Sections 1363 and 7(3).(1)

LARCENY W/IN SPECIAL MARITIME JURISDICTION - did take and carry away, with the intent to steal and purloin, the personal property of another having a value of less than $1,000.00, a misdemeanor. In violation of Title 18, United States Code, Sections 661 and 7(3).(2)

UNLAWFUL TRANSPORT OF FIREARMS, ETC. - having been convicted of a crime punishable by imprisonment for a  term exceeding one year, knowingly did possess in and affecting commerce, a firearm,  that is, a Smith &; Wesson .32 caliber pistol, which had been shipped and transported in  interstate commerce; In Violation of Title 18, United States Code" Sections 922(g)(1), 924(a)(2) and 924(e).(3)

RECEIVE STOLEN FIREARMS - knowingly did possess a stolen firearm, that is, a Smith &; Wesson  .32 caliber pistol which had been shipped and transported in interstate commerce, knowing and having reasonable, cause to believe the firearm was stolen; In violation of Title 18, United States Code, Sections 922 (j) and 924(a).(4)
